citation.article-title: Isolation and characterization of Methanobacterium espanolae sp. nov., a mesophilic, moderately acidiphilic methanogen.

p.s: Description of Methanobacterium espanolae sp. nov.
Methanobacterium espanolae (es. pa. no' lae. L. gen. fem. n. espanolae, of Espanola, named after the town of Espanola, Ontario, Canada)
Cells are often present in chains.
Grows at pH values of 7.7 or higher (higher pH values not tested).
H2-CO2 is the only methanogenic substrate used for growth.
The G+C content of the DNA is 34.0 mol% (as determined by the Tm method).
The type strain of Methanobacterium espanolae is strain GP9.
This strain has been deposited with the National Research Council of Canada culture collection as strain NRC 5912.
The source of strain GP9T was methanogenic enrichment from the anoxic zone of primary sludge from a bleach kraft mill.
